title: Here's how to make karela more tolerable, stuff it with paneer! : How to, News - India Today
text:
Here's how to make karela more tolerable, stuff it with paneer! You might hate its taste, but bitter gourd has nutritional benefits that make it a must-have. A + A - This bharwa karela recipe will make bitter gourd more tolerable for your palate. Picture courtesy: Pinterest/kirantarun.com 
If there's one thing Indian parents and grandparents have forced down their children's throats, it's karela or bitter gourd. 
Whether you're from the north or the south, we're sure you've nearly collapsed due to an overdose of karela fry or chips or sabji. If you're a karela-hating Bengali, the daily shukto with chopped bitter gourd must have been the stuff of nightmares! Stuffing and deep frying karela can make it more palatable. Picture courtesy: Pinterest/Archana's Kitchen 
But we all have to admit that despite its eye-watering taste, karela has immense nutritional benefits. Not only does this vegetable purify blood, but it also keeps the sugar levels in it under control. It doesn't matter if you have piles, constipation, diabetes or unhealthy skin--karela is the one-stop solution to all your troubles. 
Also read: 5 easy-cheesy naan pizzas you can make at home today 
If only there was a way to make this bitter gourd more tolerable, we'd actually enjoy having it more often. And guess what? There is a way. 
Stuffing a karela is always a better way to enhance its taste. And while heavily spiced mixes are a good idea, it's also better to add something like paneer or cottage cheese to the stuffing. Why? The bland, milky flavour of paneer can be a good way to counter the excessive bitterness of karela. Give this spicy paneer-stuffed bitter gourd recipe a try. Picture courtesy: Pinterest/kirantarun.com 
Just take a look at this bharwa karela recipe. 
Ingredients: 
5 medium-sized karela or bitter gourd 
1/2 cup fresh paneer, finely chopped 
1 medium-sized onion, finely chopped 
1 tsp cumin seeds 
1 tsp green chillie, chopped 
1/2 tsp turmeric powder 
1/2 tsp red chilli powder 
1/2 tsp cumin powder
